system.description:
Mass murder in the Gallowsway district. The dead bear marks that defy easy explanation, and the circumstances suggest something far worse than common violence.

  • Proceed to Charnel House 17 and examine the murder scene.
  • Inspect the bodies—many appear to have been dead far longer than the killings would suggest.
  • Recover and examine the xenos artefact fragment found at the scene.
  • Identify the body of Darnis Fayne and determine his connection to the killings.

The trail of the body trade leads downhive, through territory claimed by one of Desoleum's most brutal gangs.

  • Follow the trail from the Fayne Mortuarius through the Purity Gate into Gantry.
  • Navigate the territory of the Red Walk gang and their leader, Vornas Crimson.
  • Obtain the location of the Blessed Flesh cult's hideout—through alliance, coercion, or the blood sport of the Knife Lock arena.

The Blessed Flesh cult operates from a hidden stronghold deep in the Underhive—a massive archeotech construction platform rising from the toxic sump-river.

  • Locate the cult's hidden lair using intelligence gathered from the Red Walk.
  • Approach through stealth, force, or guile—the path is treacherous and well-guarded.
  • Reach Ferrue Fayne before he can complete his summoning ritual.

The heretic psyker Ferrue Fayne stands at the centre of the Blessed Flesh cult, wielding a xenos artefact that amplifies his already formidable psychic powers.

  • Confront and defeat Ferrue Fayne, leader of the Blessed Flesh cult.
  • Recover or destroy the xenos artefact that amplifies his abilities—without it, his Psy Rating drops from 4 to 3 and the ritual collapses.
  • Neutralise any remaining cult leadership to prevent reorganisation.

The veil has been torn. If the summoning ritual succeeds, the Herald of Nurgle Aynthrexes manifests in the material world, surrounded by an army of animated dead.

  • Banish or destroy the daemon before it can fully anchor itself in reality.
  • Prevent Aynthrexes from leading Ferrue's army of reanimated corpses across Hive Desoleum.
  • Survive. The Emperor protects.

A strange, asymmetrical device painful to look upon, of clearly non-human manufacture and potentially millions of years old. It greatly enhances psychic connection to the Warp and grants the wielder the power to animate dead flesh.

While in possession of the artefact, a psyker increases their Psy Rating by 1 and can use psychic powers to reanimate corpses. However, proximity to the artefact causes feelings of unease and mild nausea. Characters who handle the artefact unprotected must pass a Challenging (+0) Willpower test or gain 1 Corruption point.

The artefact is a key piece of evidence and should be recovered for the Inquisitor.
A staff imbued with psychic circuitry that channels the wielder's psychic might into devastating strikes. Only a character with a Psy Rating can use this weapon's special abilities.
